page.title: 07TRADITIONAL EVENTS IN PENDLE
page.content: On the second Saturday in August we have the Rushbearing Ceremony. This dates back to medieval times when rushes covered the floors of the Church and houses. The custom was revived in l9l0 and nowadays a Queen and attendants are chosen. There is a procession where the children carry posies and rushes and following this is a short church service. Another popular occasion is the Village Fete, Barley, held on the third Saturday in August on the picnic area. This event is organised by the Village Hall Committee to raise funds. The main attractions are children's races, tug of war, fell race, afternoon teas provided by Barley Women's Institute, and a brass band. In the evening a dance is held for over l6s in the Village Hall.
